messageBody:
whynotcode wrote:

> I am a new member of this group. I have a question for u people.
> I have a method which overwrites value of a private variable. This
> method is public and I need to test that method. Is it ok to set the
> value of the private var using reflection and then check the method
> in the test case ?

When you ask, "Is it OK?" in what way do you think it might not be OK?

What you propose works, because it tests what you want to test: "Does my
method properly write the expected value to the expected field?" There
are, however, certain drawbacks to this approach. Still, so much depends
on your goals, so I'll ask again, but differently: what are you afraid
of that might /not/ be OK with what you're proposing?
